description: Unique identifier for the operation configuration used to route and manage work requests.
Human-readable label for the service area handling work requests.
Extended description of the service area’s scope, policies, or usage.
Target completion timeframe in days for requests; whether calendar or business days should be confirmed with SME.
Delimited list of users to be notified on key events for requests under this operation.
Name of the responsible workgroup or team to which requests are assigned.
Custom field for organization-specific data; meaning varies by implementation—confirm with SME.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last modified the record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification.
Category or type of service for reporting or routing; exact taxonomy may vary—confirm with SME.
Identifier of the report/print template used for work request documents.
Indicates whether non-authenticated users can submit requests for this service.
Indicates whether submitted requests require approval before work begins.
Indicates whether workflow routing steps are enforced for requests in this service area.
Display or processing order used when listing multiple operations.
Controls whether a post-completion survey is sent to requestors.
Indicates whether new requests are automatically assigned to a default assignee or group; confirm specifics with SME.
